titleproper.value: Guide to the Ron Meisel Photographs of Coney Island  <lb/>  2005-2008  <lb/> <num>PR 377</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-01-17T17:21:10</date>

unittitle.value: Ron Meisel photographs of Coney Island

abstract.value: This collection consists of 10 color photographs of Coney Island, taken by photographer Ron Meisel (1952-) between 2005 and 2007. Images include amusement park attractions and participants in the annual Mermaid Parade. Also included is a small exhibition catalog, "Greetings from Coney Island" from a 2008 exhibition of Meisel's photographs at the Brooklyn Public Library.

p.value: Open to qualified researchers by appointment only.
Credit line should read: Â© [date], Ron Meisel
Five photographs were purchased and five photographs were the gift of the artist, Ron Meisel.

Photographer Ron Meisel was born in New York City in 1952. He worked as a computer programmer and consultant form 1972-2001. Meisel joined the Soho Photo Gallery, a cooperative photography gallery, in 2003, and began photographing Coney Island in 2004.

Eight of the photographs are panoramic photos taken on color negative film and scanned on an Epson scanner.  All of the photos were printed on archival paper using an Epson 4800 printer with Epson Ultrachrome K3 inks. The 8 panoramic photos measure 17"x42" and the remaining 2 photos measure 17"x22".

subject.value: Parades -- New York (State) -- New York   -- Photographs
